questions.question_text: What technology does Prisma Access utilize to provide scalability and resilience?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Prisma Access leverages Cloud-Delivered Security Services (CDSS) to provide scalability and resilience across its distributed cloud infrastructure. CDSS enables dynamic scaling, global coverage, and high availability by delivering security functions like advanced threat prevention, DNS security, and DLP from the cloud—ensuring consistent protection and performance regardless of user location. B. SD-WAN Edge relates to traffic routing, not Prisma Access core scalability.

choices.C: Integration with ZTNA 2.0 through Prisma Access
choices.D: ZTNA 2.0 plug-in to integrate with the branch firewall
choices.B: CloudBlades API for ZTNA 2.0 to protect the cloud applications

questions.question_text:
An organization wants to adopt a Zero Trust Network Access (ZTNA) model for enhanced security across its network, especially for protecting cloud applications and branch office connectivity.

Which specific feature of Prisma SD-WAN should be recommended to this organization?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Prisma SD-WAN integrates seamlessly with Prisma Access to deliver ZTNA 2.0, which provides comprehensive protection for users accessing cloud applications and branch office connectivity. This integration ensures least-privilege access, continuous trust verification, and deep application-layer visibility—all foundational to Zero Trust.

questions.question_text: What is a benefit of the Palo Alto Networks secure access service edge (SASE) solution's ability to provide insight into SD-WAN and network security metrics while highlighting critical issues across all managed tenants?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D make sense, the question says "across all managed tenants"

Selected Answer: D
Only D makes sense for me

choices.C: It simplifies workflows and instantly automates common use cases with hundreds of prebuilt playbooks.
choices.B: It helps protect inbound, outbound, and east-west traffic between container workload types in Kubernetes environments without slowing development speed.
choices.D: It helps managed service providers (MSPs) accelerate troubleshooting and meet service level agreements (SLAs) for all their customers.
choices.A: It rearchitects the way signatures are delivered, performing updates and streaming them to the firewall within seconds after the analysis is done.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Prisma SD-WAN IONs (Instant-On Network devices) intelligently engineer site-to-site traffic up to Layer 7 (Application Layer) of the OSI model. This allows for application-aware routing, ensuring decisions are made based on application identity, performance metrics, and business policy—not just IP addresses or ports.

questions.question_text: IONs intelligently engineer site-to-site traffic up to which layer of the OSI?
Which Prisma Access component ensures consistent security policy enforcement across all users?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
User-ID is a core component of Prisma Access that enables identity-based policy enforcement. It maps traffic to specific users and user groups, regardless of their physical location, which allows security policies to follow the user consistently—whether they are on-campus, remote, or mobile.

This ensures that access control, threat prevention, and visibility are applied based on user identity, not just IP addresses or locations. A. Cloud Management – Provides a centralized interface but doesn’t enforce policies directly.

Selected Answer: A
Should be A
consistent security policy enforcement is done with Strata Cloud Manager.
This ensures a consistent policy across all users.
